name: LSASS Process Access for Token Theft [T1134.001]
description: Detects processes accessing LSASS with access rights that allow token duplication (0x0040 = PROCESS_DUP_HANDLE). The Fawkes C2 agent 'steal-token' command opens LSASS to duplicate tokens for privilege escalation. Legitimate LSASS access from non-system processes is rare, making this a high-fidelity detection.
query: winlog.event_data.TargetImage:*lsass.exe AND winlog.event_data.GrantedAccess:(0x0040 OR 0x1FFFFF OR 0x1010 OR 0x1410 OR 0x1438 OR 0x143a) AND NOT process.executable:(*csrss.exe OR *lsm.exe OR *wininit.exe OR *services.exe OR *svchost.exe OR *WmiPrvSE.exe OR *msiexec.exe OR *Windows?Defender*)
false_positives: Legitimate security tools that scan LSASS (AV engines, EDR agents)
Windows Error Reporting crash handling for LSASS
Task Manager or Process Explorer querying process information
author: blue-team-agent
